description: This workflow described how to download RNA-seq raw data from NCBI or EBI and to process them to quantify transcript abundance.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Trim reads with Trimmomatic. Assign to $adaptfile variable the appropriate file name containing primer sequences (found in the Trimmomatic folder).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Trim reads with Trimmomatic. Assign to $adaptfile variable the appropriate file name containing primer sequences (found in the Trimmomatic folder).

source_data.name: java -jar /home/tduge/trinity/Trimmomatic-0.32/trimmomatic-0.32.jar PE -threads $thread_number ${acc_sra}_1.fastq ${acc_sra}_2.fastq ${acc_sra}_1P.fq ${acc_sra}_1U.fq ${acc_sra}_2P.fq ${acc_sra}_2U.fq ILLUMINACLIP:$adaptfile:2:30:10 LEADING:3 TRAILING:3 SLIDINGWINDOW:4:15 MINLEN:36
source_data.description: Trim paired RNA-seq reads with Trimmomatic

components.data:
Quantify transcript abundance against a reference transcriptome assembly.

Assign the reference transcriptome to the $sid variable (the fasta assembly may be downloaded in Ensembl for example).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Quantify transcript abundance against a reference transcriptome assembly.

Assign the reference transcriptome to the $sid variable (the fasta assembly may be downloaded in Ensembl for example).

source_data.name:
forward=${acc_sra}_1P.fq
reverse=${acc_sra}_2P.fq

salmon index -t $assembly -i ${assembly}_quasi_index --type quasi -k 31
salmon quant -i $sid -l A -p $thread_number --useVBOpt -1 $forward  -2  $reverse -o ${acc_sra}_transcripts_quant_quasi_vbo --seqBias
source_data.description: Prepare reference index and quantify transcript abundance

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of RNA-seq quantification from published data
source_data.annotation: assembly and quantification may be switch to the lightweight-alignment (SMEM), please read the doc @ http://salmon.readthedocs.io/en/latest/salmon.html#quasi-mapping-based-mode-including-lightweight-alignment
source_data.thread_text: assembly and quantification may be switch to the lightweight-alignment (SMEM), please read the doc @ http://salmon.readthedocs.io/en/latest/salmon.html#quasi-mapping-based-mode-including-lightweight-alignment
source_data.body: assembly and quantification may be switch to the lightweight-alignment (SMEM), please read the doc @ http://salmon.readthedocs.io/en/latest/salmon.html#quasi-mapping-based-mode-including-lightweight-alignment

components.data:
Identify RNA-seq runs of interests and get a DRR/ERR/SRR accession number.

In a bash script, assign the accession number to the $acc_sra variable.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Identify RNA-seq runs of interests and get a DRR/ERR/SRR accession number.

In a bash script, assign the accession number to the $acc_sra variable.

source_data.name:
if [ ${#acc_sra} -eq 9 ]; then
                        proz -k=8 --force -r --no-curses ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/${acc_sra:0:6}/${acc_sra}/${acc_sra}_1.fastq.gz -P $acc_wd
                         gunzip ${acc_sra}_1.fastq.gz
                        proz -k=8 --force -r --no-curses ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/${acc_sra:0:6}/${acc_sra}/${acc_sra}_2.fastq.gz -P $acc_wd
                        gunzip ${acc_sra}_2.fastq.gz
                                else
                                if [ ${#acc_sra} -eq 10 ]; then
                                        proz -k=8 --force -r --no-curses ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/${acc_sra:0:6}/00${acc_sra:9:9}/${acc_sra}/${acc_sra}_1.fastq.gz -P $acc_wd
                                        gunzip ${acc_sra}_1.fastq.gz
                                        proz -k=8 --force -r --no-curses ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/${acc_sra:0:6}/00${acc_sra:9:9}/${acc_sra}/${acc_sra}_2.fastq.gz -P $acc_wd
                                        gunzip ${acc_sra}_2.fastq.gz
                                        else
                                        if [ ${#acc_sra} -eq 11 ]; then
                                                 proz -k=8 --force -r --no-curses ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/${acc_sra:0:6}/0${acc_sra:9:10}/${acc_sra}/${acc_sra}_1.fastq.gz -P $acc_wd
                                                gunzip ${acc_sra}_1.fastq.gz
                                                proz -k=8 --force -r --no-curses ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/${acc_sra:0:6}/0${acc_sra:9:10}/${acc_sra}/${acc_sra}_2.fastq.gz -P $acc_wd
                                                gunzip ${acc_sra}_2.fastq.gz
                                                else
                                                        proz -k=8 --force -r --no-curses ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/${acc_sra:0:6}/${acc_sra:9:11}/${acc_sra}/${acc_sra}_1.fastq.gz -P $acc_wd
                                                        gunzip ${acc_sra}_1.fastq.gz
                                                        proz -k=8 --force -r --no-curses ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/${acc_sra:0:6}/${acc_sra:9:11}/${acc_sra}/${acc_sra}_2.fastq.gz -P $acc_wd
                                                        gunzip ${acc_sra}_2.fastq.gz
                                                fi
                                fi

                        fi
source_data.description: use Prozilla to download data from the EBI

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 1 of RNA-seq quantification from published data
source_data.annotation: k option in prozilla indicates the number of CPUs
source_data.thread_text: k option in prozilla indicates the number of CPUs
source_data.body: k option in prozilla indicates the number of CPUs
